question: The degree of the differential equation <katex>$1+(\frac{dy}{dx})^{2}+(\frac{d^{2}y}{dx^{2}})^{2}=\sqrt[3]{\frac{d^{2}y}{dx^{2}}+1}$</katex> is
explanation: To find degree, remove radicals. Cube both sides.
In the LHS, <katex>$(y'')^2$</katex> is cubed, so <katex>$(y'')^6$</katex> will appear.
Degree is the highest power of the highest derivative, which is 6.
